availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David L. Wells (Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and capt 16th ky vol inf.)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William R. Wells and Elizabeth Gault Wells. Farmer in Mason County in 1850. Farmer in Mason County in 1860. Served in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant and captain from October 28, 1861, to August 8, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 3, p. 156B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, District 3, p. 275.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000281842, p. 117 of 469 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0297.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #915312, Certificate #688424.
Find A Grave, "David L Wells (1823-1909)," Memorial #17809487, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17809487 (accessed January 8, 2021).
